wikipedia_page.main: Joseph Elkington (baptised 1 January 1740 at Stretton-on-Dunsmore, died October 1806) was an English agriculturalist, lauded by parliament for his reforms to land drainage.

response: His grandfather was the land drainage reformer Joseph Elkington.
Land-drainage reformer Joseph Elkington developed his drainage techniques while farming at Princethorpe.
Land drainage reformer Joseph Elkington was baptised at Stretton in 1740 and farmed nearby.

* Joseph Elkington (1740-1806) English agriculturalist, lauded by parliament for his reforms to land drainage. Elkington moved to Hey House in Staffordshire in 1797 to farm 500 acres of land at Madeley which became known as Bog Farm.
